No one is sure where or why gravity exactly spawns from, even with our revelations into the Higgs field. If time is arbitrary, why do we only try to describe gravity as an object pulling on another. With time in reverse, gravity acts in the opposite direction. The pull of gravity in this sense is really just a prehistory of where the object will end up. The location of a particle billions of years from now is predetermined and these forces are there to push us along to those paths. Maybe gravity is simply a byproduct of the inevitable changes of the higgs field that MUST occur. Maybe the graviton’s existence and strength is an emergent property of space’s shape just as time is but doesn’t suffer from the observational relativity inherent in observing an event and measuring it. If we could observe gravity at its core maybe we could find measurements that can bypass the heisenburg principle.
